DataElement.preferredName: First Degree Relative Cancer Diagnosis Colon Carcinoma Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the number of first degree relatives (parent, sibling and /or child) associated with a diagnoisis of cancer.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Report or record of a cancer diagnosis in any relative with whom one half of an individual's genes is shared (i.e., parent, sibling, offspring).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any relative who is one meiosis away from a particular individual in a family; a relative with whom one half of an individual's genes is shared (i.e., parent, sibling, offspring) (from Genetics Home Reference glossary)

Concepts.definition: Any relative who is one meiosis away from a particular individual in a family; a relative with whom one half of an individual's genes is shared (i.e., parent, sibling, offspring) (from Genetics Home Reference glossary)

Property.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Colon Carcinoma First Degree Relative Diagnosis Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor usually arising from the epithelium lining the large intestinal mucosa.  Colon carcinoma is one of the most common malignancies in both males and females, and is especially common in North America and Europe.  Grossly, most colon carcinomas are polypoid or ulcerating lesions. Microscopically, adenocarcinoma is the most frequently seen morphologic subtype.  Prognosis depends on the stage of the disease (depth of invasion, metastasis to regional/distal lymph nodes or other anatomic sites). -- 2004_Any relative who is one meiosis away from a particular individual in a family; a relative with whom one half of an individual's genes is shared (i.e., parent, sibling, offspring) (from Genetics Home Reference glossary)_The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Colon Carcinoma First Degree Relative Diagnosis Category
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor usually arising from the epithelium lining the large intestinal mucosa.  Colon carcinoma is one of the most common malignancies in both males and females, and is especially common in North America and Europe.  Grossly, most colon carcinomas are polypoid or ulcerating lesions. Microscopically, adenocarcinoma is the most frequently seen morphologic subtype.  Prognosis depends on the stage of the disease (depth of invasion, metastasis to regional/distal lymph nodes or other anatomic sites). -- 2004:Any relative who is one meiosis away from a particular individual in a family; a relative with whom one half of an individual's genes is shared (i.e., parent, sibling, offspring) (from Genetics Home Reference glossary):The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: A malignant epithelial neoplasm that arises from the colon and invades through the muscularis mucosa into the submucosa.  The vast majority are adenocarcinomas.

Any relative who is one meiosis away from a particular individual in a family; a relative with whom one half of an individual's genes is shared (i.e., parent, sibling, offspring) (from Genetics Home Reference glossary)

A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
